member.name: T:Bridge.TemplateAttribute
member.summary: TemplateAttribute is instruction to replace method calling (in expression) by required code

member.name: T:Bridge.FileNameAttribute
member.summary: The file name where JavaScript is generated to.

member.name: T:Bridge.OutputAttribute
member.summary: The output folder path for generated JavaScript. A non-absolute path is concatenated with a project's root. Examples: "Bridge\\output\\", "..\\Bridge\\output\\", "c:\\output\\"

member.name: T:Bridge.OutputByAttribute
member.summary: The option to manage JavaScript output folders and files. See TypesSplit enum for more details.

member.name: T:Bridge.OutputBy
member.summary: The options to manage JavaScript output folders and files.

member.name: F:Bridge.OutputBy.Class
member.summary: The class name will be the file name. If there are classes with same names in different namespaces, the generated JavaScript will be combined into one file. For example, if the class name is "Helpers", the file name will be "Helpers.js".

member.name: F:Bridge.OutputBy.ClassPath
member.summary: A folder hierarchy is created using the class name, and a folder is created for each unique word (split by '.') in the class namespace. For example, if the class "Helpers" is within the "Demo" namespace, the file path and name will be "Demo/Helpers.js".

member.name: F:Bridge.OutputBy.Module
member.summary: The ModuleAttribute value is used as the file name if set on a class. For example, if [Module("MyModuleName")] is set, the file name will be "MyModuleName.js".

member.name: F:Bridge.OutputBy.Namespace
member.summary: The full namespace is used as the file name. For example, if "Demo.Utilities" is the namespace, the file name will be "Demo.Utilities.js".

member.name: F:Bridge.OutputBy.NamespacePath
member.summary: The class namespace is split (by '.') and a folder is created for each individual value, except the last value which becomes the file name. For example, if "Demo.Utilities" is the namespace, the file path and name will be "/Demo/Utilities.js".

member.name: F:Bridge.OutputBy.Project
member.summary: All generated JavaScript for the project is added to one [ProjectName].js file. For example, if the project name is "MyUtilities", the file name will be "MyUtilities.js". This can be overridden by setting the fileName option within bridge.json, or by using the [FileName] Attribute on the assembly or class levels.

member.name: T:Bridge.ScriptAttribute
member.summary: ScriptAttribute is instruction how to convert method declaration (signature + implementation) to javascript

member.name: M:Bridge.Script.Write``1(System.String)
member.summary: Inject javascript code

member.name: M:Bridge.Script.Write(System.String)
member.summary: Inject javascript code

member.name: F:Bridge.Script.Arguments
member.summary: An Array-like object corresponding to the arguments passed to a function.

member.name: F:Bridge.Script.Undefined
member.summary: The global undefined property represents the value undefined.

member.name: F:Bridge.Script.NaN
member.summary: The global NaN property is a value representing Not-A-Number.

member.name: F:Bridge.Script.Infinity
member.summary: The global Infinity property is a numeric value representing infinity.

member.name: M:Bridge.Script.Eval``1(System.String)
member.summary: The eval() method evaluates JavaScript code represented as a string.
member.param: A string representing a JavaScript expression, statement, or sequence of statements. The expression can include variables and properties of existing objects.

member.name: M:Bridge.Script.Eval(System.String)
member.summary: The eval() method evaluates JavaScript code represented as a string.
member.param: A string representing a JavaScript expression, statement, or sequence of statements. The expression can include variables and properties of existing objects.

member.name: M:Bridge.Script.IsFinite(System.Object)
member.summary: The global isFinite() function determines whether the passed value is a finite number. If needed, the parameter is first converted to a number.
member.param: The value to be tested for finiteness.

member.name: M:Bridge.Script.ParseFloat(System.String)
member.summary: The parseFloat() function parses a string argument and returns a floating point number.
member.param: A string that represents the value you want to parse.

member.name: M:Bridge.Script.ParseInt(System.String)
member.summary: The parseInt() function parses a string argument and returns an integer of the specified radix or base.
member.param: The value to parse. If string is not a string, then it is converted to one. Leading whitespace in the string is ignored.

member.name: M:Bridge.Script.ParseInt(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: The parseInt() function parses a string argument and returns an integer of the specified radix or base.
member.param: The value to parse. If string is not a string, then it is converted to one. Leading whitespace in the string is ignored.

An integer that represents the radix of the above mentioned string. Always specify this parameter to eliminate reader confusion and to guarantee predictable behavior. Different implementations produce different results when a radix is not specified.

member.name: M:Bridge.Script.IsNaN(System.Object)
member.summary: The isNaN() function determines whether a value is NaN or not. Be careful, this function is broken. You may be interested in Number.isNaN() as defined in ECMAScript 6 or you can use typeof to determine if the value is Not-A-Number.
member.param: The value to be tested.

member.name: M:Bridge.Script.DecodeURI(System.String)
member.summary: The decodeURI() function decodes a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) previously created by encodeURI or by a similar routine.
member.param: A complete, encoded Uniform Resource Identifier.

member.name: M:Bridge.Script.DecodeURIComponent(System.String)
member.summary: The decodeURIComponent() method decodes a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) component previously created by encodeURIComponent or by a similar routine.
member.param: An encoded component of a Uniform Resource Identifier.

member.name: M:Bridge.Script.EncodeURI(System.String)
member.summary: The encodeURI() method encodes a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) by replacing each instance of certain characters by one, two, three, or four escape sequences representing the UTF-8 encoding of the character (will only be four escape sequences for characters composed of two "surrogate" characters).
member.param: A complete Uniform Resource Identifier.

member.name: M:Bridge.Script.EncodeURIComponent(System.String)
member.summary: The encodeURIComponent() method encodes a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) component by replacing each instance of certain characters by one, two, three, or four escape sequences representing the UTF-8 encoding of the character (will only be four escape sequences for characters composed of two "surrogate" characters).
member.param: A component of a URI.

member.name: P:System.Exception.Data
member.summary: Gets a collection of key/value pairs that provide additional user-defined information about the exception.

member.name: P:System.Exception.Message
member.summary: Gets a message that describes the current exception.

member.name: P:System.Exception.InnerException
member.summary: Gets the Exception instance that caused the current exception.

member.name: P:System.Exception.StackTrace
member.summary: Gets a string representation of the immediate frames on the call stack.

member.name: P:System.ArgumentException.ParamName
member.summary: Gets the name of the parameter that causes this exception.

member.name: M:System.Array.IndexOf(System.String)
member.summary: The indexOf() method returns the first index at which a given element can be found in the array, or -1 if it is not present.

member.name: M:System.Array.IndexOf(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: The indexOf() method returns the first index at which a given element can be found in the array, or -1 if it is not present.

member.name: M:System.Array.LastIndexOf(System.String)
member.summary: The lastIndexOf() method returns the last index at which a given element can be found in the array, or -1 if it is not present. The array is searched backwards, starting at fromIndex.

member.name: M:System.Array.LastIndexOf(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: The lastIndexOf() method returns the last index at which a given element can be found in the array, or -1 if it is not present. The array is searched backwards, starting at fromIndex.

member.name: M:System.DateTime.#ctor(System.Int64)
member.summary: Double value representing the number of milliseconds since 1 January 1970 00:00:00 UTC (Unix Epoch).
member.param: The numberof milliseconds since 1 January 1970 00:00:00 UTC (Unix Epoch)

member.name: M:System.DateTime.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: String value representing a date. The string should be in a format recognized by the Date.parse() method (IETF-compliant RFC 2822 timestamps and also a version of ISO8601).

member.name: T:System.DayOfWeek
member.summary: Specifies the day of the week.

member.name: F:System.DayOfWeek.Sunday
member.summary: Indicates Sunday.

member.name: F:System.DayOfWeek.Monday
member.summary: Indicates Monday.

member.name: F:System.DayOfWeek.Tuesday
member.summary: Indicates Tuesday.

member.name: F:System.DayOfWeek.Wednesday
member.summary: Indicates Wednesday.

member.name: F:System.DayOfWeek.Thursday
member.summary: Indicates Thursday.

member.name: F:System.DayOfWeek.Friday
member.summary: Indicates Friday.

member.name: F:System.DayOfWeek.Saturday
member.summary: Indicates Saturday.

member.name: T:System.Error
member.summary: The Error constructor creates an error object. Instances of Error objects are thrown when runtime errors occur. The Error object can also be used as a base objects for user-defined exceptions. See below for standard built-in error types.

member.name: T:System.LocaleOptions
member.summary: An object with some or all of the following properties:

member.name: F:System.LocaleOptions.LocaleMatcher
member.summary: The locale matching algorithm to use. Possible values are "lookup" and "best fit"; the default is "best fit". For information about this option, see the Intl page.

member.name: F:System.LocaleOptions.Usage
member.summary: Whether the comparison is for sorting or for searching for matching strings. Possible values are "sort" and "search"; the default is "sort".

member.name: F:System.LocaleOptions.Sensitivity
member.summary: Which differences in the strings should lead to non-zero result values.

member.name: F:System.LocaleOptions.IgnorePunctuation
member.summary: Whether punctuation should be ignored. Possible values are true and false; the default is false.

member.name: F:System.LocaleOptions.Numeric
member.summary: Whether numeric collation should be used, such that "1" < "2" < "10". Possible values are true and false; the default is false. This option can be set through an options property or through a Unicode extension key; if both are provided, the options property takes precedence. Implementations are not required to support this property.

member.name: F:System.LocaleOptions.CaseFirst
member.summary: Whether upper case or lower case should sort first. Possible values are "upper", "lower", or "false" (use the locale's default); the default is "false". This option can be set through an options property or through a Unicode extension key; if both are provided, the options property takes precedence. Implementations are not required to support this property.

member.name: T:System.CaseFirst
member.summary: Whether upper case or lower case should sort first. Possible values are "upper", "lower", or "false" (use the locale's default); the default is "false". This option can be set through an options property or through a Unicode extension key; if both are provided, the options property takes precedence. Implementations are not required to support this property.

member.name: T:System.Sensitivity
member.summary: Which differences in the strings should lead to non-zero result values.

member.name: F:System.Sensitivity.Base
member.summary: Only strings that differ in base letters compare as unequal. Examples: a ≠ b, a = á, a = A.

member.name: F:System.Sensitivity.Accent
member.summary: Only strings that differ in base letters or accents and other diacritic marks compare as unequal. Examples: a ≠ b, a ≠ á, a = A.

member.name: F:System.Sensitivity.Case
member.summary: Only strings that differ in base letters or case compare as unequal. Examples: a ≠ b, a = á, a ≠ A.

member.name: F:System.Sensitivity.Variant
member.summary: Strings that differ in base letters, accents and other diacritic marks, or case compare as unequal. Other differences may also be taken into consideration. Examples: a ≠ b, a ≠ á, a ≠ A.

member.name: T:System.Usage
member.summary: Whether the comparison is for sorting or for searching for matching strings. Possible values are "sort" and "search"; the default is "sort".

member.name: T:System.LocaleMatcher
member.summary: The locale matching algorithm to use. Possible values are "lookup" and "best fit"; the default is "best fit". For information about this option, see the Intl page.

member.name: M:System.Date.#ctor(System.Double)
member.summary: Double value representing the number of milliseconds since 1 January 1970 00:00:00 UTC (Unix Epoch).
member.param: The numberof milliseconds since 1 January 1970 00:00:00 UTC (Unix Epoch)

member.summary: String value representing a date. The string should be in a format recognized by the Date.parse() method (IETF-compliant RFC 2822 timestamps and also a version of ISO8601).

member.name: M:System.String.IndexOf(System.String)
member.summary: The indexOf() method returns the index within the calling String object of the first occurrence of the specified value, starting the search at fromIndex. Returns -1 if the value is not found.
member.param: A string representing the value to search for.

member.name: M:System.String.IndexOf(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: The indexOf() method returns the index within the calling String object of the first occurrence of the specified value, starting the search at fromIndex. Returns -1 if the value is not found.
member.param: A string representing the value to search for.

The location within the calling string to start the search from. It can be any integer. The default value is 0. If fromIndex < 0 the entire string is searched (same as passing 0). If fromIndex >= searchValue.length, the method will return -1.

member.name: M:System.String.LastIndexOf(System.String)
member.summary: The lastIndexOf() method returns the index within the calling String object of the last occurrence of the specified value, or -1 if not found. The calling string is searched backward, starting at fromIndex.
member.param: A string representing the value to search for.

member.name: M:System.String.LastIndexOf(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: The lastIndexOf() method returns the index within the calling String object of the last occurrence of the specified value, or -1 if not found. The calling string is searched backward, starting at fromIndex.
member.param: A string representing the value to search for.

The location within the calling string to start the search at, indexed from left to right. It can be any integer. The default value is searchValue.length - 1. If fromIndex < 0 or fromIndex >= searchValue.length, the method will return -1.

member.name: M:System.String.LocaleCompare(System.String)
member.summary: The localeCompare() method returns a number indicating whether a reference string comes before or after or is the same as the given string in sort order. The new locales and options arguments let applications specify the language whose sort order should be used and customize the behavior of the function. In older implementations, which ignore the locales and options arguments, the locale and sort order used are entirely implementation dependent.
member.param: The string against which the referring string is comparing

member.name: M:System.String.LocaleCompare(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: The localeCompare() method returns a number indicating whether a reference string comes before or after or is the same as the given string in sort order. The new locales and options arguments let applications specify the language whose sort order should be used and customize the behavior of the function. In older implementations, which ignore the locales and options arguments, the locale and sort order used are entirely implementation dependent.
member.param: The string against which the referring string is comparing
A string with a BCP 47 language tag, or an array of such strings. For the general form and interpretation of the locales argument, see the Intl page. The following Unicode extension keys are allowed:

member.name: M:System.String.LocaleCompare(System.String,System.String,System.LocaleOptions)
member.summary: The localeCompare() method returns a number indicating whether a reference string comes before or after or is the same as the given string in sort order. The new locales and options arguments let applications specify the language whose sort order should be used and customize the behavior of the function. In older implementations, which ignore the locales and options arguments, the locale and sort order used are entirely implementation dependent.
member.param: The string against which the referring string is comparing
A string with a BCP 47 language tag, or an array of such strings. For the general form and interpretation of the locales argument, see the Intl page. The following Unicode extension keys are allowed:
An object with some or all of the following properties:

member.summary: The match() method retrieves the matches when matching a string against a regular expression.
member.param: A regular expression object. If a non-Regex object obj is passed, it is implicitly converted to a Regex by using new Regex(obj).

member.name: M:System.String.Match(System.String)
member.summary: The match() method retrieves the matches when matching a string against a regular expression.

member.name: M:System.String.Replace(System.Text.RegularExpressions.Regex,System.String)
member.summary: The replace() method returns a new string with some or all matches of a pattern replaced by a replacement. The pattern can be a string or a Regex, and the replacement can be a string or a function to be called for each match.
member.param: A Regex object. The match is replaced by the return value of parameter #2.
The String that replaces the substring received from parameter #1. A number of special replacement patterns are supported; see the "Specifying a string as a parameter" section below.

member.name: M:System.String.Search(System.String)
member.summary: The search() method executes a search for a match between a regular expression and this String object.
member.param: A regular expression object. If a non-Regex object obj is passed, it is implicitly converted to a Regex by using new Regex(obj).

member.name: M:System.String.Slice(System.Int32)
member.summary: The slice() method extracts a section of a string and returns a new string.
member.param: The zero-based index at which to begin extraction. If negative, it is treated as (sourceLength-beginSlice) where sourceLength is the length of the string (for example, if beginSlice is -3 it is treated as sourceLength-3).

member.name: M:System.String.Slice(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: The slice() method extracts a section of a string and returns a new string.
member.param: The zero-based index at which to begin extraction. If negative, it is treated as (sourceLength-beginSlice) where sourceLength is the length of the string (for example, if beginSlice is -3 it is treated as sourceLength-3).

The zero-based index at which to end extraction. If omitted, slice extracts to the end of the string. If negative, it is treated as (sourceLength-endSlice) where sourceLength is the length of the string.

member.name: M:System.String.Split(System.String)
member.summary: The split() method splits a String object into an array of strings by separating the string into substrings.
member.param: Specifies the character(s) to use for separating the string. The separator is treated as a string or a regular expression. If separator is omitted, the array returned contains one element consisting of the entire string. If separator is an empty string, str is converted to an array of characters.

member.name: M:System.String.Split(System.Text.RegularExpressions.Regex)
member.summary: The split() method splits a String object into an array of strings by separating the string into substrings.
member.param: Specifies the character(s) to use for separating the string. The separator is treated as a string or a regular expression. If separator is omitted, the array returned contains one element consisting of the entire string. If separator is an empty string, str is converted to an array of characters.

member.name: M:System.String.Split(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: The split() method splits a String object into an array of strings by separating the string into substrings.
member.param: Specifies the character(s) to use for separating the string. The separator is treated as a string or a regular expression. If separator is omitted, the array returned contains one element consisting of the entire string. If separator is an empty string, str is converted to an array of characters.
Integer specifying a limit on the number of splits to be found. The split method still splits on every match of separator, but it truncates the returned array to at most limit elements.

member.name: M:System.String.Split(System.Text.RegularExpressions.Regex,System.Int32)
member.summary: The split() method splits a String object into an array of strings by separating the string into substrings.
member.param: Specifies the character(s) to use for separating the string. The separator is treated as a string or a regular expression. If separator is omitted, the array returned contains one element consisting of the entire string. If separator is an empty string, str is converted to an array of characters.
Integer specifying a limit on the number of splits to be found. The split method still splits on every match of separator, but it truncates the returned array to at most limit elements.

member.name: M:System.String.Substring(System.Int32)
member.summary: The substring() method returns a subset of a string between one index and another, or through the end of the string.
member.param: An integer between 0 and the length of the string.

member.name: M:System.String.Substring(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: The substring() method returns a subset of a string between one index and another, or through the end of the string.
member.param: An integer between 0 and the length of the string.
An integer between 0 and the length of the string.

member.name: M:System.String.Substr(System.Int32)
member.summary: The substr() method returns the characters in a string beginning at the specified location through the specified number of characters.
member.param: Location at which to begin extracting characters. If a negative number is given, it is treated as strLength+start where strLength = to the length of the string (for example, if start is -3 it is treated as strLength-3.)

member.name: M:System.String.Substr(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: The substr() method returns the characters in a string beginning at the specified location through the specified number of characters.
member.param: Location at which to begin extracting characters. If a negative number is given, it is treated as strLength+start where strLength = to the length of the string (for example, if start is -3 it is treated as strLength-3.)
The number of characters to extract.

member.name: M:System.String.ToLowerCase
member.summary: The toLowerCase() method returns the calling string value converted to lowercase.

member.name: M:System.String.ToLocaleLowerCase
member.summary: The toLocaleLowerCase() method returns the calling string value converted to lower case, according to any locale-specific case mappings.

member.name: M:System.String.ToUpperCase
member.summary: The toUpperCase() method returns the calling string value converted to uppercase.

member.name: M:System.String.ToLocaleUpperCase
member.summary: The toLocaleUpperCase() method returns the calling string value converted to upper case, according to any locale-specific case mappings.

member.name: T:System.Threading.Tasks.IPromise
member.summary: CommonJS Promise/A interface http://wiki.commonjs.org/wiki/Promises/A

member.name: M:System.Threading.Tasks.IPromise.Then(System.Delegate)
member.summary: Adds a fulfilledHandler to be called for completion of a promise.
member.param: The fulfilledHandler is called when the promise is fulfilled

member.name: M:System.Threading.Tasks.IPromise.Then(System.Delegate,System.Delegate)
member.summary: Adds a fulfilledHandler, errorHandler to be called for completion of a promise.
member.param: The fulfilledHandler is called when the promise is fulfilled
The errorHandler is called when a promise fails.

member.name: F:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskStatus.Created
member.summary: The task has been initialized but has not yet been scheduled.

member.name: F:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskStatus.WaitingForActivation
member.summary: The task is waiting to be activated and scheduled internally by the .NET Framework infrastructure.

member.name: F:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskStatus.WaitingToRun
member.summary: The task has been scheduled for execution but has not yet begun executing.

member.name: F:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskStatus.Running
member.summary: The task is running but has not yet completed.

member.name: F:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskStatus.WaitingForChildrenToComplete
member.summary: The task has finished executing and is implicitly waiting for attached child tasks to complete.

member.name: F:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskStatus.RanToCompletion
member.summary: The task completed execution successfully.

member.name: F:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskStatus.Canceled
member.summary: The task acknowledged cancellation by throwing an OperationCanceledException with its own CancellationToken while the token was in signaled state, or the task's CancellationToken was already signaled before the task started executing.

member.name: F:System.Threading.Tasks.TaskStatus.Faulted
member.summary: The task completed due to an unhandled exception.
